channel.title: Project Outlast
channel.description:
[b]Project Outlast[/b]
Project Outlast started as a joke project, but turned into something more. While it's still a side project, I'd like some help with it. I'm looking for developers, beta testers, and plenty of unique ideas, or criticism.
The base is Project Insanity.
If you'd like to contact me via Skype: highryan1233 or pm me here.
[size=14pt]To see the development thread look here: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,668421.0.html[/size]
[b]Features[/b]
-Good karma, Bad karma system -Bad karma has the capability to enslave other players and gain a reward. -Good karma players gain a reward by slaying those of evil karma and can place a bounty on their head if they want. -Start out as a slave escape, (first quest) then begin your adventure throughout the world of project outlast. -Choose your starter and training method. -Unique items catered to each karma system. -Various different quests which have various rewards. -Certain objectives can only be completed if player has a certain karma. -Great stability -Perfected Combat, range, melee, mage. -Interesting approach to the game, a lot of future potential. -Lots of different ways to play. -Revamped many different variants of economy. -Ingame highscores -Unique shops buy and sell, barter system. Higher the players barter the more they get for selling and item, less they get the item for. -Players can repair own equipment such as barrows, vestas with a certain level of repair skills which is linked with smithing. -Areas are discovered then have the ability to teleport to them.
Looking for content developers asap.
Application: [spoiler]Name: Skype: Experience: Idea/questions?: [/spoiler]
I hope you decide to join, as this is a fun project and is a relaxed development team. Thank you, and hope to hear from you all soon.
Media:
[img]http://imageshack.com/a/img661/7065/ffDzoy.png[/img]
[img]http://imageshack.com/a/img538/3493/Pymkob.png[/img]
[img]http://imageshack.com/a/img673/9830/iv3nJO.png[/img]
[img]http://imageshack.com/a/img661/166/2IJh78.png[/img]
[img]http://imageshack.com/a/img631/5764/yozwMX.png[/img]
[img]http://imageshack.com/a/img673/2268/20mN6n.png[/img]
This is just the beginning.

item.title: Project Outlast
item.dc:creator: @elmo88 elmo88
item.description:
@elmo88 wrote:

I guess content developer, server/client sided. I’d like to beta test now if possible lol looks awesome. And like I said I have a lot of ideas. Talk skype though so we’re not spamming thread.

Ps: I hope it’s serious not many teams nowadays are…

Read full topic

item.title: Project Outlast
item.dc:creator: @Project_Territh Project Territh
item.description:
@Project_Territh wrote:

[quote=“elmo88, post:6, topic:549328”]Name: David
Skype: I pmed you it.
Experience: Not much to be honest, just small things I can help out with such as shops, autospawn, and adding custom items I’m quite good at. Add me on Skype, I’ll show you my work.
Ideas: I have a whole lot of those.
Questions: Do we have a vps? Do we have a website? How serious is this project? I would love to join sounds very interesting and unique and would like to be apart of something new. Rather than just the same old thing. I love this, and would love to help out in anyway I can.[/quote]

Added you on Skype we’ll talk there, what position are you applying for?

And to answer your questions:
Do we have vps: Yes
Do we have website: No
How serious is this project: To be honest not sure yet, I’d like to try to make something cool out of it.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“mrbad23, post:2, topic:549328”]Name:Roderick
Skype:Mrbadrsps
Position applying for:Co-owner
Experience:a little bit of java. 4 years in the rsps buisness
Proof: if (c.playerName == Mrbad23);
c.sendMesssage(“I dont need proof :o”);
}
Why should you be apart of the team:[/quote]
Rofl, with that kind of programming skill, you do.

On a pi you would use:

if(c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("mrbad23")) { c.sendMessage("I cannot write simple if statements correctly."); }

And you didn’t even finish the application. smh.

Edit: On topic: Good luck on this Ryan, I know you tried it in the past but didn’t get far. Hopefully this time is different.

item.title: Project Outlast
item.dc:creator: @Project_Territh Project Territh
item.description:
@Project_Territh wrote:

Project Outlast

Project Outlast started as a joke project, but turned into something more. While it’s still a side project, I’d like some help with it. I’m looking for developers, beta testers, and plenty of unique ideas, or criticism.

The base is Project Insanity.

If you’d like to contact me via Skype: highryan1233 or pm me here.

[size=14pt]To see the development thread look here:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,668421.0.html[/size]

Features

-Good karma, Bad karma system
-Bad karma has the capability to enslave other players and gain a reward.
-Good karma players gain a reward by slaying those of evil karma and can place a bounty on their head if they want.
-Start out as a slave escape, (first quest) then begin your adventure throughout the world of project outlast.
-Choose your starter and training method.
-Unique items catered to each karma system.
-Various different quests which have various rewards.
-Certain objectives can only be completed if player has a certain karma.
-Great stability
-Perfected Combat, range, melee, mage.
-Interesting approach to the game, a lot of future potential.
-Lots of different ways to play.
-Revamped many different variants of economy.
-Ingame highscores
-Unique shops buy and sell, barter system. Higher the players barter the more they get for selling and item, less they get the item for.
-Players can repair own equipment such as barrows, vestas with a certain level of repair skills which is linked with smithing.
-Areas are discovered then have the ability to teleport to them.

Looking for content developers asap.

Application:
[spoiler]Name:
Skype:
Experience:
Idea/questions?:
[/spoiler]

I hope you decide to join, as this is a fun project and is a relaxed development team.
Thank you, and hope to hear from you all soon.
